title: Number searchability
creator: Catbus
content: When I reconcile my checking account each month, it's handy to be able to search my e-mail for the amounts of transactions that I can't identify by name alone. Gmail allowed me to do this. Thunderbird, for some reason, doesn't. Anytime I search for a numerical value (e.g., "36" or "9.58"), Thunderbird returns no results. Why are numeric strings not searchable? Is anyone working on this deficiency?

title: Prevent automatic marking as read for one mail account
creator: username419
content:
Hi there,

I currently have three email accounts set up in my Thunderbird client. I’d like to disable the automatic marking of messages as read—but only for one specific account (mainly for my colleagues’ convenience, as it’s a shared inbox).

In Settings > General, I see the option to turn off "Automatically mark messages as read", but this would apply to all my accounts, which isn’t what I want. I’ve checked the Account Settings for the relevant account and couldn’t find a per-account option. I also looked for an add-on that might help, but so far, no luck.

Has anyone found a workaround or solution for this? Any advice would be greatly appreciated !

Thanks in advance, Cheers.

The google authentication pop up launches " Mozilla Thunderbird wants to access you Gmail" and I click "Allow"


As soon as I click "Allow" I am asked to download a file.

Google gemini says this file is a sign that Oauth is not being accepted by thunderbird.

please help, Thunderbird has never been able to connect to gmail when running on this Ubtuntu install.

title: Thunderbird problem
creator: gyron
content:
[edited]@btopenworld.com


Help

I really have given up on Thunderbird, even though I have been a loyal supporter of the product for many years.

For the last year I have had to bypass Thunderbird and read my emails either on my mobile or directly from the BT server, which is how I am writing this mail.

My problem is , although I can view my mail perfectly on my mobile and of course on the BT server, Thunderbird seems totally incapable of transferring the mail to the Thunderbird inbox.

Thunderbird is not able to show the text and any images, all I get is a mail with a number of boxes, no pictures or anything of any use.

Is this since a Thunderbird 'update' or what, I don't know.

A little while ago I posted this problem and only got one reply from an 'expert'/community which failed to solve problem in any way.

I have also lost many of my earlier mail

Is it time to abandon Thunderbird and change to the dreaded Microsoft email package?

Yours faithfully in great expectations that someone somewhere most know how to fix Thunderbird

title: "Reply with Template" always uses encryption, resulting in corrupted e-mail reply
creator: antifascist
content:
When my message filter uses the "Reply with Template" action, the reply e-mail is always PGP encrypted, even when I do not have any public key for the recipient e-mail address. As a result, the reply e-mail is always corrupted.

I am using Thunderbird 140.7.1esr on Windows 10.

I have attached a screenshot of what the reply e-mail always looks like.

In the Template that I am using, the "encrypt" button is not selected, and in the OpenPGP menu of the Template, the "Encrypt" menu item does not have a checkmark next to it.

Does anyone know how I can get Thunderbird to send reply e-mails without using encryption?

Tale opzione può essere modificata nelle impostazioni dell’account nella sezione Bozze e modelli da cui posso effettuare diverse scelte. Il problema nasce con l’account della PEC di Aruba che mi salva obbligatoriamente la Bozza nelle cartelle Locali di Thunderbird e non in quella dell’account della PEC. Questo succede anche con i messaggi inviati, anche essi vengono salvati in Inviati o Sent delle cartelle locali e non in quella dell’account. Ho provato a modificare le opzioni Cartella posta inviata su… imposto l’indirizzo PEC , ma non appena invio o salvo la bozza Thunderbird me lo commuta nuovamente a Locale. Come posso risolvere questo problema?

title: Problema di autenticazione utente dopo reset della password con account infomaniak.com
creator: Parnassius21
content:
Buongiorno, per qualche ragione che non comprendo, successivamente ad un normale cambio della password del mio account email su infomaniak.com, Thunderbird non accetta la nuova password e continua a richiedere l'inserimento delle credenziali. La password è corretta (test positivo di accesso tramite webmail e app android). Le impostazioni dell'account sono conformi ai settaggi consigliati da Infomaniak. Il test disponibile in Thunderbird per verificare la corretta comunicazione del server IMAP e SMTP risponde correttamente e non evidenzia alcun problema (img1.jpg). Ogni volta che inserisco la password il programma procede con la connessione con mail.infomaniak.com:993 senza problemi ma al momento della connessione accade qualcosa durante il "Controllo della funzionalità del server di posta..." (img2.jpg). La password non viene accettata e si ripresenta continuamente la finestra con la richiesta di Inserire una nuova password. Ho quindi provato in modo empirico a facilitare il più possibile le cose e ad eliminare possibili difficoltà, tra cui: 1) eliminare l'account infomaniak presente in Thunderbird e ricrearlo da zero; 2) disabilitare il firewall locale (ESET); 3) rimuovere l'autenticazione a due fattori; 4) ricambiare e semplificare la password dell'account; 5) creare una password specifica per Thunderbird tramite la funzione infomaniak "Password app"; 6) provare a collegarmi connettendomi ad una WAN diversa da quella attraverso la quale il problema si verifica; 7) rimozione delle credenziali salvate in Impostazioni -> Privacy e Sicurezza -> passwords e reinserimento da zero; Purtroppo nessuno di questi passaggi ha sortito alcun effetto risolutivo ed attuamente non mi è più possibile accedere al mio account infomaniak tramite Thunderbird come ho fatto senza alcun problema, da anni. Non nascondo che questo rappresenta un grosso problema.

Il problema è conosciuto? Ci sono metodi di risoluzione (ad es. cancellazione delle cache, file di storage delle psw)? Qualsasi consiglio sarà ben gradito.

Grazie! Simone

Hello, for some reason that I don't understand, after a recent reset of my account password (login is well working from browsers and Infomaniak Mail Android app), Mozilla Thunderbird continue to request to insert the new password but it is not recognized. It establish correctly a connection with standard infomaniak email services and ports, conformly with the reccomended settings. In the settings the communication test with mail.infomaniak.com:993 is right and well (see img1.jpg) but at the connection something happen during the control of funcionality from mail server... (see img2.jpg). I already try to: 1) delete the local account and reconfigure it in Thunderbird as new account; 2) suspend local firewall protection (ESET); 3) remove two-factor authentication (MFA); 4) simplify the password; 5) create a new and different password exclusively for for Thunderbird in the function "Password app"; 6) try to use a different internet connection; 7) remove and re-creation of record password storage by Thunderbird in Settings -> Privacy and Security -> passwords. No one of that step solve and actually I can access to my mailbox from Mozilla Thunderbird. It appear as a big problem. Can you help me? Really thank's
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;os:Microsoft Windows 11 - 64bit;solver_id:7394761
